ygData.subject: Re: Q' about Netted/Mesh
ygData.msgSnippet: Another place to get netted is from the low level lizards in feerrott, near the Innothule swamp.  This, however, is not suggested, as the ogre bouncers
ygData.messageBody:
Another place to get netted is from the low level lizards in feerrott, near
the Innothule swamp. This, however, is not suggested, as the ogre bouncers
(guards) tend to roam all over, and it's very easy to get lost. Also the
swamp is very dangerous, because there are a few higher level mobs in the
area, namely Jojongua the kobold. That, and it's pretty easy to gather
quite a crowd of frogs while you're fighting one. Another idea, though, is
to simply go to the swamp and auction to buy it. There should be plenty of
low level trolls with some to sell. Don't pay too much for it tho, as the
protection is equivalent to cloth.

Getting to Qeynos isn't that difficult, and is definitely possible at your
level. Check out this website for maps -

members.door.net/enigma/eqmap.htm

It would be best to travel with a shaman, druid, or bard for speed.

Good luck...

Ryugen
Bertoxxulous

>Hail Brother's & Sisters,
> First of all I would like to say Thank you to the many people that take
>the time to answer Q's from new'B players like myself, I hope you know that
>the info you share is very appreciated!.
> Now on to the Q's!
>I have read many things about Netted/Mesh armor, and am planing to start
>"Questing" for some. What I need to know though is, is this armor somthing
>that I will actualy "make" (ex. making patch work armor out of hides) and
>if so, what do I need to do this? just a sewing kit, or do I need to use
>some of my traing ponits in a certain skill area?. I am now on the cusp of
>tenth LvL, Is that high enough to start hunting what ever creatures will
>"give" me netted/mesh?. Also, I am a Freeport monk, I hear much talk about
>the sewers of Qeynos (think that is the place) But nothing of were to hunt
>for the creatures I am looking for in my area. (Here is a VERY New'b Q, If
>i do need to go to Qeynos, how do i get there, by boat or try it overland?)
>I thank you all in advance for your time.
>
>Zarvitz, monk of the 9th circle.
>"May Quellios guide your mind so that you may guide your fists"
